Side Effects: Severe Joint pain
Comments: I told my Dr. I was sick of taking Actos and wanted to try something else.  Big mistake_ Januvia gave me massive pain in one knee to the point where I could barely walk.  I also went to an Orthopedic Surgeon just to have my knee checked out and they found nothing wrong.  I've been off the drug for 4 weeks and the pain is better but not even closer to normal. Now back on Actos and my Blood Sugar count is actually worse than before I stared on Januvia.  My numbers in the morning were always around 120_ now they are in the 130's and a few have even been in the 150's.  I think this stuff has done permanent damage_ or is at least going to take a lot more time for me to recover.

Side Effects: I had been taking Januvia 25 mg  with Metformin ER for 4 months then the DR just increased it to Januvia 50 mg a day. Well_ within 2 weeks_ my finger joints hurt_ and  my fingers began swelling. Then_ my ears seemed plugged all the time. Not much longer_ the diarrhea set in just after eating or drinking anything. Then_ I had diarrhea all day / night long. Finally_ I was sooooo dizzy that I couldn't get out of bed and dry heaves were very_ very nasty. I took myself off Januvia and within 2 days the dizziness stopped. The diarrhea is ongoing.
Comments: The side effects are sooo nasty. With all the diarrhea_ the Metformin ER pills I take end up in the toilet bowl. All_ in all_ looks like this was a really bad medicine to take. My DR has no understanding of these side effects.

Side Effects: OmG the swelling in my feet is ridiculous. My husband first noticed my upper stomach getting bigger. At first I thought he was teasing me about gaining weight but that was januvia. Gained 6 lbs in one week. I'm done. Going back to invocana. I'll deal with the yeast infection. Now here comes these horrible leg cramps. My poor husband has to deal with me screaming in the middle of the night. And now during the day. This is just crazy.
Comments: Oh and my counts are going nuts too. They usually are in the high 90's and low 100's. I woke up this morning and it was 165. Very high for me. I'm so done. Sorry dr.

Side Effects: Leg weakness and lower back pain

Reason: Help to lower fasting blood sugar
Side Effects: About two hours after taking the medication I started to feel very cold. My legs and feet and arms were  extremely cold while my face felt feverish. I had a serious bout of diarrhea and flu like symptoms. My Dr told me to get off Januvia.
Severe constipation and abdominal pain in my lower front ab. Stopped taking medicine.
Doesn't do anything for glucose levels
Muscle cramps. Abdomen pain.Constipation. Muscle weakness. Tired and irritable all the time.

Severe abdominal pain on front upper right side and across the lower front of abdomen.  Symptoms started about 60 days ago.  Usually worse in the evening but goes away during the night and morning.  Never had any problems with the drug.  Recent ultrasound test were normal.  I stopped taking the drug 5 days ago and abdomen is instantly back to normal.  No pain.  Doctor notified and will see him next week to change med.  Feeling much better now.
Comments: My BG average reading slowly increased over the last year so I don't think the Januvia was working.  Also take Metformin and Glipizide with it.  Started Actos 45 days ago to lower my A1c which had been at 7.5.  Just had lab test and it is now 9.1 so not sure if Actos is working.  Based on the side effects of Actos_ I think I want to get off it if possible.  I had never experience such abdominal pain with a diabetic drug like Januvia.  However_ I took Victoza for about a month before Januvia and it also upset my stomach but not as bad as Januvia.  I was diagnosed diabetic at the age of 61.

Side Effects: Severe joint and muscle pain increasing in all extremities.  Right side stomach pain that also radiated trough to back.  Swelling of lower legs PLEASE SEE MY COMMENTS
Comments: Over a 2 year period I went from being an active and healthy 6Â’1 205 lb 52 year old male to a 54 year old crippled. Please note that I had NO problems prior to starting this drug. Over the last 2 years these symptoms crept up on me so be careful and alert.   NOW TO GET TO FOR THE GOOD NEWS AND OFFER HOPE FOR OTHERS THAT MAY BE EXPERIENCING THE SAME ISSUES... for the new year I was having to change healthcare providers and my new carrier would not pay for Januvia and with a cost of $380 per month I wasn't going to be able to continue it.  As a consequence_ I was then put on Metformin in mid-December 2015.  Within 2 weeks of stopping Januvia I was realizing that my joint and muscle pain was subsiding.  As the following weeks went by I couldn't believe how much better I was feeling and was becoming very hopeful-so here is my update as of today 02/07/2016 7 weeks since I stopped taking Januvia.  My muscle pain is GONE.  Joint pain down 85 % and getting better everyday.  Stomach and back pain took longer to get relief_ but over the last 2 weeks it is now GONE.  Leg swelling is GONE. There is no question that this drug was the problem  so if you are experience any of these please consider this may be the issue for you.  The positive is that it can resolve very quickly after stopping the drug.

Side Effects: None
Comments: It works quickly

Side Effects: Glipizide was making me sick_ so new Dr started me on Januvia. A few days later started having stomach pains_ confusion_ fast heartbeat_ anxiety_ shakiness_ weakness & waking at night and other side effects. Has not helped my blood glucose numbers
Comments: Not willing to take it anymore. Calling my Dr to see about an alternative.?

Side Effects: I had numb and cold extemities_ high blood pressure eith a severe headache.
Comments: I ended up with a case of pancreatitis;with the worst pain_nausea and vomiting in my life.

Reason: Because i was loosing weight not c
Side Effects: With januvia i am taking nidopal 850 mg after food januvia in 30mg morning but i am feeling pain on shoulders feeling tiyard while walking.
Comments: My suger level in fasting is ok

Side Effects: Terrible Flu Symptoms_ Fever_ Flushing Face_ Cold Feet_ RLS_ Creepy Crawling sensation all over_ Loose stools_ Malaise and Lethargic_ Stomach pain and cramping
Muscle pain
Comments: This helped control my blood sugar with minimal side effects.  Worked well for me I took it in addition to 2000mg of Metformin daily. AIC 6.2 while on this

Side Effects: Mild nausea the first few days. No side effects other than that.
Comments: Not sure if it's really helping lower my BG_ but it has lowered my A1C

Side Effects: Skin rashes with blisters and extreme muscle and joint pain.
Comments: I would warn people to research the medication that your doctor prescribes before you start it. Especially the side effects and serious side effects.

Side Effects: For the most part its not a bad drug. Took a week to kick in. BG levels are great! Problems? Major constipation for like a month and a half. Things finally started getting better after that. I still have some discomfort in my lower abdomen.
a little nausea but nothing bad.
Comments: I have no idea if it's working or how long it takes to work. There doesn't seem to be any information on this which is very frustrating.

Side Effects: About 3-4 days after starting  I began to have terrible blurred vision & watering eyes(had to pull over on highway) because eyes hurt so bad_ honestly had to fight to keep them open. The were also burning. Went to eye Dr he noticed that eyes were very red_ but could not tell me why.  I reviewed my medicine and decided that the only thing I was doing different was taking the j. Tried taking half of the j and still had bad eye problems.  Also had the worst stomach pain in my life. No nausea or vomiting_ just pain for 1 day only. I stopped taking j after 2 weeks.  It's. Even about 3 wks now_ I still have the burning & stinging & slight blurred vision_ but not as bad. It is now hard for me to read letters_ books & signs now. I am hoping and praying that as time goes on I regain whatever it is that I lost when it comes to my vision. Also noticed that I was beginning to have a very negative attitude.
Comments: Sugar levels went up instead of down.

Side Effects: Slight nausea but no other side effects so far
Cough flu symptoms not well no energy pains in arms
Comments: handed a prescription for this last week by Diabetic Nurse due Sugar levels being high. Diet controlled for the last 9 years.i have tried Metformin for a couple of weeks but felt poorly.not impressed with this feel not myself Changed colestral tablet at same time why don't know as this had not changed. Nurse could not tell me. patients should be able to see doctor when being prescribed for the first time. I am going to stop Januvia and see if I feel better

Side Effects: Headache that never went away_ terrible fatigue_ had to sleep in my car on my lunch break! No appetite at all_ and my morning blood sugars also actually increased by about 100 points!  After a few days_ the severe back and hip pain started. Just not worth it.
Comments: With the pancreatic cancer potential and the fact that it does not work at all for me_ I will be asking for an older more tried and true medication from my dr.

Reason: My a1c level was a little high
Side Effects: My feet are tingling_ and they feel like they are froze in blocks of ice.
Comments: I am a chronic pain patient as well as a type two diabetic_ so I don't really know if it's the Januvia or my back causing this_ but since taking it_ my feet feel like they are frozen in blocks of ice_ yet they are not really cold. I'm wearing 3 heavy pairs of socks yet they are still cold "feeling"

Side Effects: It's keeping my BS down 86-105 _ but I'm always tired & my workout has suffered was bench pressing 455_ now I'm down 2 405_ don't no what 2 do
Fatigue_ cold all the time
Comments: Tried Metformin for a months but had side effects. The Doctor gave me four weeks of sample Trajecta (?) and I didn't have any side effects. Express Scripts wouldn't appove Trajecta w/o me trying Januvia first. Now I have a 90 days of Januvia ready for the trash can.

Side Effects: extreme nausea_ leg pain_ fatigue_ muscle weakness_ sweating_ anxiety_ depression
Caused my mother to develop Stage 4 Kidney disease.

Started out having muscle aches. subsided and thought BGL were doing better. Also plus_ was never being too low. After two months now have constant higher levels above 200 and many times above 250. Never happened on Metformin alone. I question now if Januvia is causing more issues then helping.
Comments: I suspect from reading other results that Januvia could be negatively affecting my pancreas. So much so_ it could be damaging it.

Side Effects: I was fine for two weeks_ although seemed hungry all the time. Then I became all stuffed up and sore throat_ and it wasn't a cold. Then the ANXIETY hit and depression. a little anxiety and then full blown the next day. I stopped it and in two days I was just fine again. Be careful with these new drugs. The hold one's and less expensive worked just as well.

within a few weeks of starting Januvia i became terribly ill in bed sick for 4 weeks(extreme chills_nausea_achy_diarrhea). The extreme chills lasted for the 5 months off and on. Also leg pain(felt like I was going to get a leg cramp_ tightening in muscles continuously_could barely walk). Also had tingling in legs_ feet and hands almost continuously with little relief. Would NEVER recommend this pill to anyone...
excellent no side effects at all perfect sugar control

I've never had trouble with my knees or leg now I have the most horrific left knee pain. It almost seems that something is knawing inside my knee and at times I want to give up. I  cry a lot. It is so hard for me to walk and I've lost sleep due to this disgusting pain. My poor husband tries to help but their is nothing he can do for me. My fingers on my left hand are extremely painful_ swollen and won't bend. I hate this. I just hate it.
No side effects until my 4 th day then...Sickness_ nausea_ severe leg and back pain in hip and knee Ankle pain ShakesDilution and disphoriaIrritability Depression Angsiety
I had no side effects from Januvia at all.
Comments: Adding Januvia to my other prescriptions (Metformin and Glipizide) had a great effect on my blood sugar levels and I was very pleased. However_ when I read about the increased chances of pancreatitis and possibly pancreatic cancer_ I stopped taking it. I am once again having problems regulating my sugar level so I would not be surprised to be on insulin soon. Some studies I have read indicate that Januvia is safer when taken with metformin but I don't know how true that is. I was very happy to get the effects I experienced_ but I am very apprehensive about the possible risks.

Side Effects: None
Comments: HbA1C dropped from 7.2 to 5.9 with a little dietary change too. Lost a few pounds. No side effects_ but expensive. It took a while to fully kick in - 3 months?

Side Effects: I can't really give an answer_ as I have been on and stopped after 1 day. However_ good things came from learning I was Diabetic_ so there are many possitive side effects from that.
Comments: After finding that I am Diabetic & that my Dad (75) takes Januvia with great results_& finding that there is a Pancreatic Cancer risk_ I decided that at my age of 46_ that I best control my A1c level which was at 6.5_ with diet changes instead of a pill. I eliminated McDonald's Sweet Tea_ Dollar menu food_ Ice Cream_ I stopped going to fast food for lunch and started eating more Home cooked foods for lunch_ along with lots of Cheese and wheat thin's and no longer drink the typical Diet Soda's.-These changes have dropped my A1c over the last 9 months to 6.2 & according to my Dr. will continue to drop.  My weight has stayed at 250 lbs which is still very heavy_ but I was at 263 lbs with no stop in sight. Now that I have my Blood sugar under control without Januvia (http://www.pancreaticcancerlawsuit.org/januvia/) and warnings of Lawsuits due to increased Pancreatic Cancer_ I am so glad I opted out of this drug & decided after the classes on Diabetes and how it destroys your body_ I was scared straight! -Also_ with 3 Back Surgeries and Stabbing pain in my quads and lower back_ Hip_ Calf & Feet Pain_ I am shortly going in for a 4th Back Surgery_ after trying Nerve Cut Rhizotomy_ which seemed to work initially but we found that I have so many underlying pains that Dr. Rao could perform these continually with the same poor result.  The good news with Rhizotomy's is that the nerve grows back! in 6 months to 2 years. So I did a trial with the "Boston

Side Effects: absolutly none__lov it___i was on metformin and it nearly killed me__no dr told me what was wrong__ a druggist at walgreens ask me how i was doin as drs kept giving more scripts__i told her i wouldnt live thru winter__she said tell your dr u want off metformin__i did and she put me on janueva and with in 2 months i was back again__could walk__i had lost my hair__constant diarrea___couldnt get out of a chair and left with diabetic neuropthy___now my sugar is always normal__low carb and a walk everyday___i lov this med even with syptoms__with metformin id be dead by now____

I am a 72 year old woman with type 2 diabetes. When diagnosed I was put on the drug from hell--metforman. It was then changed to Januvia. I have had no side effects from this drug. Combined with a low carb diet it controls my Blood Glucose very well. I think anyone who relies only on medication no matter what the medication is and fails to limit carbs and doesn't exercise is asking for trouble. I feel better than I have in a long time. Dropping some weight has brought my blood pressure down and my low carb diet has lowered my cholesterol.In my opinion if your doctor just issues pills without telling you to diet and exercise he is doing you a disservice. If you don't take control of your own disease then heaven help you

this caused severe sinus congestion_ bloody noses_ leg cramps_ loss of appitite_ rise in blood sugar levels and excessive sleepiness. given with metformin_ these symptoms increased. and dizziness and fainting.
Comments: be very careful what you take these drugs with like cholersteral lowering drugs. they're time bombs! and make sure your doctor educates you on how to lower your sugar levels with diet and excercise too!

Side Effects: Severe Migraine with Aura
Comments: Did not reduce my blood sugar levels when compared with treatment by Glipizide 5mg BID and Metformin 1000mg BIDActual Prescription was for Janumet 50/1000 BID

Side Effects: severe body pain_ sore throat_ fatique_ naseau_ constipation and off and on  head aches and felt very drowsy. Yet could not have good sleep since body pain caused me to wakeup every 3 hours
Comments: I am a 63 year old type 2 diabtetes patient for the last 6 years. I also take medication for hypertension since 2001(lisnopril and Olmesezt). I have been taking amaryl(2mg) with Metformin(500mg) and Gilprimide for the last 5 years with good control of blood sugar levels. However my doctor prescribed 100 mg of Januvia with metformin-500mg made a veras a more efficient alternative to Amaryl. I started taking this Januvia since marhc of this year and I noted in the first 2 months some general tiredness and my fasting blood sugar was high -130 mg/dl compared with 90 mg/dl with amaryl. More importantly after 3 months of Januvia i started having intense body pain_ constipation tiredness_ headache_ sore throat in the morning_ nauseua and trouble concentrating. i was advised to take vitaminD-3-2000iu every day. I did that for the last 2 weeks and it has not reduced these symptoms. I stopped Genuvia since last monday and my tiredness and body pain has reduced considerably. I still do not have the energy I HAD before starting on Januvia. I switched back to Amaryl and my blood sugar is back under control. Is this a common experience to the side effect of Januvia. I am convinced that Merck introduced a dangerous drug in the market and someone should take this up with the FDA. I hope that I do not have permanent damage to my system due to 3 months of januvia. By profession_ I am a synthetic organic chemist with a doctorate in organic chemistry and I also must tell you that januvia is lo

Side Effects: I almost got Stephen Johnson syndrome from this medication.  Doctor told me I had come in just in time because of the major rash I got around my anal area. Another week and I would have been in deep trouble.
Comments: It helped me control my blood sugar.

Side Effects: severe side pain_ back pain. fatigue.
Comments: at first it seemed ok then after a few months i started having pancreatitis symptoms. i wouldn't recommend this drug to anyone

Side Effects: none really
Comments: Taken Januvia for about 2 1/2 months with Metformin and seams to be lowering my blood sugar.Last A1C test was 6.7_down from 7.0 the last time.Will see next time i take the A1C in 3 months to make my final judgement on this medicine.

Side Effects: First 4 weeks had bad heart burn_ only Alkaseltzer fixed that.  Then 3weeks of little side effect. Last 2 weeks of stomach pain.
Comments: Switched from Actos to this and energy improved but stomach pains were too much.  Now on Glimepride 2mg.  working good so far.  Januvia worked well to control blood sugar levels but too much pain_ and fear of pancretitis.

Side Effects: Began taking drug inApril 2010 .After increasing unwellness  was taken ill in night with vomiting and extreme pain. No warning this might happen. Taken to hospital urgently by ambulance. Diagnosed with pancreatitis. 5 days in Intensive care ward. Months to regain some strength.
Comments: I had checked side effects on-line. No mention of pancreatitis. Now there is_ and a note that it "may lead to inflammation _may be severe and lead to death." I would never have taken the tablets if I had read that before . Who in their rught mind would ???

Side Effects: Tingling and numbness in both legs and left arm.   Extreme fatigue.    Zero appetite.  Tachycardia.
Comments: While taking this drug I felt terrible.   After four weeks of being unable to sleep because of pain/tingling/numbness in legswhich felt as if the blood flow had been cut off_I discontinued it. It took 2 weeks for symptoms to subside. It took many visits to the doctors investigating my symptoms before I myself decided to come off the drug.    My Family Physician had no idea of these side effects.

Side Effects: After about 6 months_ I began to have pain in my thighs_ making it difficult to walk. After discontinuing Januvia_ the pain disappeared in a couple of days. My sugar level did not change much
Comments: and remained at a satisfactory level with diet and exercise. However_ my sugar levels are rising again and I am resuming Januvia_ hoping the problem will not return.

Side Effects: Lots of pain and numbness_ especially in the hands and joints. Hands become numb and very cold_ seemed as if blood flow to hands decreased. very stuffy almost like i had a cold.
Comments: Sitagliptin (marketed as Januvia and Janumet) - acute pancreatitisAudience: Diabetes healthcare professionals_ patients[Posted 09/25/2009] FDA notified healthcare professionals and patients of revisions to the prescribing information for Januvia (sitagliptin) and Janumet (sitagliptin/metformin) to include information on reported cases of acute pancreatitis in patients using these products. Eighty-eight post-marketing cases of acute pancreatitis_ including two cases of hemorrhagic or necrotizing pancreatitis in patients using sitagliptin_ were reported to the Agency between October 2006 and February 2009. It is recommended that healthcare professionals monitor patients carefully for the development of pancreatitis after initiation or dose increases of sitagliptin or sitagliptin/metformin. Sitagliptin has not been studied in patients with a history of pancreatitis. Therefore_ it is not known whether these patients are at an increased risk for developing pancreatitis and the medication should be used with caution and with appropriate monitoring in patients with a history of pancreatitis. Considerations for healthcare professionals_ information for patients_ and a Data Summary are provided.[09/25/2009 - Information for Healthcare Professionals1 - FDA]

Side Effects: Completely stuffy nose and head for an entire month_ which was so bad I could not sleep. This led to my taking all kinds of sudafed and other cold meds to try to counteract it. The stuffiness started to subside after a month_ but by then I stopped taking the medication.
Comments: My blood sugars have been very high and januvia was added to the lantus and glucovance I was already taking. The medication had no effect on lowering my blood sugar_ so I chose to stop taking it. With my insurance it still was a high co-pay. My doctor told me afterwards she was not surprised it did not lower my blood sugars that much.

Side Effects: Constant headache and nausea_ sore throat_ runny/ stuffy nose_ severe mood swings_ higher than normal blood sugars esp. morning
Comments: My doctor decided to add Januvia to help with my morning highs (~ 130 - 175) which glucovance alone was not correcting... while on Januvia_ not only did i feel terrible but I started noticing very high blood sugars both in the morning (175) and 2 hrs post meal (180 - 255!!)... I would typically drop and become hypo in the middle of the day and was forced to eat more carbs than typical to get the levels back up... stopped taking it after 18 days when the mood swings and irritability got really bad and close monitoring of blood glucose show much better results now that I'm off Januvia (90 - 130 in the a.m. and 110 - 160 2hrs post meal!)

Side Effects: None so far. Blood sugar drop significantly (from 120 to 85). Still recuparating from taking ACTOS.
Comments: So far so good.

Side Effects: Very heavy sugar laden mucous drainage in throat when laying down. Nose stopping up a lot and hard to clear head of mucous. Sometimes using up to 150 tissues at PM to rid throat of mucous and this is very tiring_ Runny nose when up and about sometimes.
Comments: It does a good job of maintaining my sugar levels I need_ and I take it along with 2 each 6 mg. Glyburid tabs pills each day. The Glyburid does appears to do nothing by itself.

Side Effects: Initially I did have lower blood sugars but I am experiencing swelling_ numbness and pain in my hands and forearms_ has anyone else experienced this?  I have had to take lortab just to sleep at night because the pain is so intense! I have quit taking it (as of 2 days ago) to see it it will go away.  The pain isn't as bad but my hands are still somewhat numb and very swollen! This drug scares me!
Totally useless_ increased blood sugars.
Comments: My blood sugars were running at about 200 all of the time (prednisone induced diabetes)_ started Januvia and although it decreased my hunger somewhat_ it caused my blood sugars to go up to close to 300. Discontinued Januvia and started taking Actos_ which is much_ much worse!

Side Effects: None
Comments: Concerned regarding the news of possible acute pancreatic problems??

Side Effects: Bloating_ headaches_ joint problems_ sleep issues_ extreme tiredness.
Comments: I stopped taking it 4 weeks ago and for the first time ever my A1c is 9.7 and my nonfasting BSL was 324...is it possible that this drug actually caused my pancreas to stop producing insulin altogether?

Side Effects: During the first month I experienced symptoms similar to flu or sinus allergy...was aware of this side effect beforehand and took an antihistamine to help tone down the symptoms until the side effects wore off after 1 month.  After the first month no major problems.
Comments: I switched to Januvia last year due to too many problems with the side effects of the Actos diabetic drug that I was on before-weight gain_ carb cravings_ myopathy_ etc.  I had taken Actos for over 18 mths and despite different types of strict exercise and diet routines the weight gain piled on and I felt like I was losing muscle strength on top of it.  So I did some online research to find another diabetic med and narrowed it down to Januvia and Byetta-I chose Januvia because I didn't want to deal with the injection routine of Byetta.  I knew about the side effects that some people had with Januvia before I took it_ so I took an antihistamine the first month for the flu like symptoms and added extra CoQ10 (conenzyme 10_ a necessary enzyme for energy production) for the myopathy like symptoms to my diet.  Since the first month I haven't had any problems and Januvia helps to keep my blood sugar in better control_ suppresses the carb cravings and I got my muscle strength back.  Maybe for some of you adding CoQ10 may help you to stay on Januvia-please discuss it with your MD and research this important supplement.  After being on Januvia for just over a year_ I got my life back and have no other major problems with it.

Side Effects: My blood sugar numbers did not improve by taking Januvia_ in fact they increased.  I attributed it to the overall pain that I had after I started taking the drug_ it started with hip joint pain that made it impossible to walk up stairs_ followed by elbow joint pain_ a complete and utter feeling of fatigue and constant pain.  When I woke in the morning_ sometimes it felt like I had been a punching bag all night.  This led to mild depression.
Comments: Two days after I stopped taking Januvia_ the hip pain was gone_ I was able to walk stairs again_ I have a renewed feeling of well being again AND my blood sugar numbers are so much better_ by 30%

Side Effects: None this is the best thing that happened to me since I was diagnosed 9 years ago.
Comments: I'm small 102 pounds and maintain my weight. Even with all of the testing_ exercise_ and small meals my sugar was high while on 20mg glyburide and 30mg Actos daily. I had a bad time with the actos swelling_ aggravated sinus_ allergies. I never felt it really was effective_ plus bone loss was evident after four or five years.I insisted that my doctor let me try something new so I could get off the actos. I was perscribed 100mg Januvia one time a day and stayed on glyburide. The Januvia was affective immediately and lasts 24 hours. AIC dropped from 7.6 to 6.4 in six months.

Side Effects: I have been steadily losing weight since switching to Januvia from Avandamet. Average weight loss for the past seven months has been about three pounds a month. I have not changed my diet or been exercising more since switching to Januvia. My doctor did have to double my dose of Januvia after the first three months because it wasn't controlling my blood sugar as well.
Comments: I have not experienced any other side-effects other than desired weight loss. Since starting to take Avandia and Avandament 5 years ago_ I had gained about 40 pounds_ averaging 8 pounds a year. I have already lost half of that weight in the past seven monhts. I feel great.

Side Effects: muscle cramps_sore throat
Comments: At 1st this was a great med. for me then I developed muscle cramping that I had already had taking Metformin and this drug made it worse....My BS #'s are low but I cannot handle the pain....

Reason: didn"t like the effects of metformi

Side Effects: mild sore throat_ runny noise_ increased post-nasal drip_ increased appetite (especially for starchy food)
Comments: Took 100mg/day and while it was a relief from the excessively smelly flatulence from the Metformin_ didn't really help my blood sugar as much as I had hoped.  Also_ the cold-like symptoms I got were somewhat annoying because I never knew if I was catching something or not.  The change before/after meal was actually better than that for Metformin (ie_ not as much of a change in before/after when I ate a lot of carbs)_ but it made my fasting and post-exercise blood sugar a lot worse.  I also felt more sluggish on Januvia_ possibly from the higher blood sugar.  I'm hoping that maybe the combination of Januvia + Metformin will work out really well -- the Januvia for the meals and Metformin for all the other times.

Side Effects: weight gain increased hunger
Comments: by itself did not work had to add glipizide

Side Effects: Intense migraines
Pnemonia_ pink eye_ sinus infection_ these side effects are all over the internet....
Comments: I took it for about 8 months and was sick all the time and I am usually never sick.  It really depleted my immune system- be careful_ if it is doing this you are more susceptible to other illnesses_ maybe even cancer....I stopped taking and have not been sick since.

Side Effects: No side effects that I'm aware of.
Comments: Was taking Metformin (worked like a charm) but had to change meds due to kidney problems.  Have taken Januvia for 2 months and my glucose readings are VERY high.  It obviously does nothing ........

Side Effects: Increased blood pressure_ heart pounding
Comments: Once I stopped the 100mg daily dose I was taking my blood pressure normalized from 156/100 back to its normal 125/80. I think that the reports of headache might be people with high blood pressure. This medicine did help my blood sugar readings but I found it was not all that effective for me_ now taking 2000 metformin (I was taking this while on januvia) and .05 prandin. The prandin is great_ works really quickly and a very low dose dropped my levels down fast_ but it is almost too strong. Also I am concerned about having to make my beta cells work too hard so I am going to get off the prandin asap

Side Effects: My glucose went down and was often normal but I started feeling congested all the time. Then I caught a bad upper respiratory infection and twice my throat closed up on me making it very hard to breathe. I normally do not catch anything. Now I have a cough that won't go away still after 3 weeks. I suspect the januvia caused these troubles.
None
Comments: Love the switch to Januvia.  Glucophage made me too sick.  Januvia is awesome!

Side Effects: glucose readings went up
Comments: After taking it for about a year I weaned myself off and now my readings are better. I don't think it works unless you have type 2 bad_ mine is more on the insulin resistance borderline side.

Side Effects: None
Comments: Easy to take_ but not highly effective
